metadata.name: Artesunate 60 mg Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Artesunate is indicated for the initial treatment of severe malaria in adult and pediatric patients L14099

contraindications.disease: Data regarding overdoses of artesunate are rare L14099 Patients experiencing an overdose may present with pancytopenia melena seizures multiorgan failure and death L14099 Treat overdose with symptomatic and supportive measures L14099
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Artesunate is an artemisinin derivative that is metabolized to DHA which generates free radicals to inhibit normal function of _Plasmodium_ parasites A18389 L891 L14099 It has a short duration of action due to its short half life and a moderate therapeutic index L891 L14099 Patients should be counselled regarding the risk of post treatment hemolytic anemia and hypersenstivity L14099

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Artesunate
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Artesunate
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Artesunate
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta is combined with Artesunate
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Artemether
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Lumefantrine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Thiethylperazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Promazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Prochlorperazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Triflupromazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Fluphenazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Thioridazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Moricizine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Trifluoperazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Perphenazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Mesoridazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Acetophenazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Promethazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Alimemazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Methotrimeprazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Periciazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Acepromazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Aceprometazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Pipotiazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Thioproperazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with BL 1020
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Cyamemazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Propiopromazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Perazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Butaperazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Chlorproethazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Thiazinam
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Dixyrazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Perphenazine enanthate
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Chlorpromazine
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Methylene blue
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Artesunate is combined with Dapsone
The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Vemurafenib is combined with Artesunate
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Phenytoin
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Sorafenib
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Mefenamic acid
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Diflunisal
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Rifampicin
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Fosphenytoin
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Deferasirox
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Eltrombopag
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Regorafenib
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Isavuconazole
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Umifenovir
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Indomethacin
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Ketoconazole
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Flunitrazepam
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Dovitinib
The metabolism of Artesunate can be decreased when combined with Chenodeoxycholic acid
The metabolism of Artesunate can be increased when combined with Phenobarbital
The serum concentration of Artesunate can be decreased when it is combined with Ritonavir
The serum concentration of the active metabolites of Artesunate can be reduced when Artesunate is used in combination with Nevirapine resulting in a loss in efficacy
